definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: murmur, growl, roar, be boisterous ( Targum [[הֲמָא]], but rare, and perh. not genuine Aram.; cf. Ar. hamhama murmur);—

growl like a dog [[כַּכָָּלֶב]] Ps 59:7, Ps 59:15, subj. wicked men; groan (in distress, lamentation), like bears [[כַּדּׂבִים]] Is 59:11 (‖[[כיונה הגה]]); of doves (also in sim.) Ez Eze 7:16 cf. Da (si vera l., vid. supr.).

murmur, fig. of soul ([[נֶפֶשׁ]]) in discouragement Ps 42:6, Ps 42:12, Ps 43:5; in prayer Ps 55:18, Ps 77:4 (both ‖[[אָשִׂיחָה]]); also subj. [[מֵעִים]] of the thrill of deep-felt compassion or sympathy, sq. [[לְ]] of person pitied, Je 31:20 (‖[[רחם ארחמנו]]), sq. [[עַל]] Ct So 5:4; further [[כַּכִּנּוֹר]] like the lyre (zither) Is 16:11; [[כַּחֲלִילִים]] like flutes, subj. [[לֵב]] Je 48:36 (sq. [[לְ]]); v:Je 48:36 (sq. [[אֶל]]); cf. Je 4:19 [[לִי לִבִּי הׂמֶה־]].

roar, of waves, subj. [[גַּלִּים]] Je 5:22, Je 31:35, Is 51:15 cf. Ps 46:4; sim. of roar of multitudes Is 17:12, Je 6:23, Je 50:42; metaph. id., Je 51:55; be tumultuous, of peoples Ps 46:7 (‖[[מָטוּ]]); Ps 83:3 (‖[[נׇֽשְׂאוּ ראׁשׁ]]).

be in commotion, stir, of city 1Ki 1:41, Is 22:2; so pt. fpl. as subst. [[הׂמִיּוֹת ראׁשׁ]] Pr 1:21 head of stirring, bustling streets (‖[[פתחי שׁערים]]); of man, [[אַח־הֶבֶל יֶהֱמָי֑וּן]] Ps 39:7 surely to no purpose they bustle about (‖[[יִתְהָלֶּח־אִישׁ אַח־בְּחֶלֶם]])

be boisterous, turbulent, as with wine Zec 9:5 (but rd. perh. [[דָּמָם]] cf. Fi:Hexapl. ii. 3, 1024 Klo:Th LZ, 1879, 564 Sta:ZAW 1881, 18); also pt. as adj., of [[שֵׁכָר]] (by meton.) Pr 20:1; of shameless woman Pr 7:11, Pr 9:13.
